content.description: Sit start on the right-hand side of the small boulder and traverse left just under the lip. Top out on the left arete.
content.location: Sit start on the right-hand side of a small boulder just above the backside of the U.S.B. boulder, but downhill from the Tsunami boulder.

content.description: Sit start up on top of a small boulder a couple of feet to the right of A Monkey's Banana on the right-hand arete. Move your left hand up into a very cool crack undercling, throw a heel hook around the arete, and grab the top of the boulder. Mantle it out.
content.location: Sit start a couple of feet to the right of A Monkey's Banana up on top of a small boulder on the right-hand arete.

content.description: Sit start around the left-hand arete of the downhill face of the United States Of Banana boulder down in a hole. Climb up out of the hole and onto a slab to top out.
content.location: Sit starts in a hole around the left-hand arete of the downhill face of the U.S.B. boulder.

content.description: Sit start on two small crimps on the right and flag a left leg underneath the boulder. Pull up and into the start of The Golden Banana.
content.location: Sit start for The Golden Banana. Located on the backside of the U.S.B. boulder.

content.description: Sit starts a couple of feet to the right of Chiquita. From the starting edge, go straight up using small crimps and staying right of Chiquita.
content.location: Sit starts a couple of feet to the right of Chiquita on the same sloper edge and climbs straight up.

content.description: Sit start to the right of Monkey See on a sloper edge and use an interesting vertical crack to get high feet and reach the top.
content.location: Sit start further right of Monkey See and go straight up.

content.description: Stand start on two decent incut crimps on the roof, slap up and left to a good sloper horn near the lip, and then slap for the top with your right hand and cut your feet. The mantle is the hardest part.
content.location: On the backside of the United States of Banana boulder, there is a small roof (facing away from the Breadloaf).

content.description: Sit start on the left-hand side of the downhill face of the United States Of Banana boulder and climb straight up the corner to the obvious diagonal shelf. Traverse to the right on the shelf and top out to the immediate left of A Monkey's Banana.
content.location: Sit starts on the left-hand side of the downhill face of the United States Of Banana boulder and traverses right to top out to the left of A Monkey's Banana.

content.description: Sit start a couple of feet to the right of Banana Bread on a sloper edge. Mantle up onto the edge using bad crimps up above and stand up to either jump to or reach the top.
content.location: Sit starts a couple of feet to the right of Banana Bread and goes straight up.

content.description: Sit start as for Easy Does It on the left-hand arete of the downhill side and traverse right underneath the diagonal shelf used on Easy Does It. Top out as for A Monkey's Banana.
content.location: Sit starts as for Easy Does It and traverses low into A Monkey's Banana to top out.

content.description: Sit start on the backside of the U.S.B. boulder to the left of The Golden Banana. Climb straight up and over a small bulge.
content.location: Sit starts on top of a small boulder to the left of The Golden Banana.

content.description: Start just underneath a small roof on bad crimp edges and then slap for good holds on the lip. Mantle up over the lip.
content.location: Around the backside of the United States of Banana boulder and to the left of The Golden Banana and Banana Scoop.

content.description: Stand start just around the Slipstream arete to the right on the slab. Work straight up the slab to the top.
content.location: Located around the Slipstream arete to the right, the first problem on the slab.

content.description: Sit start in the center of the face down low in a crack pocket. Move up into an undercling crack jug and then into a very large undercling sloper edge about halfway up the face. From there, get your feet up and slap for the sloping top. The top out is the hardest part. Hold on for dear life as you scramble to find feet that are good enough to propel over the top just enough to grab an amazing jug.
content.location: In the center of the front side of the United States of Banana boulder (facing the Breadloaf).

content.description: Just past the Breadloaf on the powerline lies the United States of Banana boulder straight ahead and slightly to the left. There is a government survey marker somewhere on top of the boulder. There are some fun dynamic problems with interesting movements on this boulder.
